channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Towards Explainable Motion Prediction using Heterogeneous Graph Representations
item.description: In this work, we aim to improve the explainability of motion prediction systems by using different approaches.

item.title: Reconciling a Centroid-Hypothesis Conflict in Source-Free Domain Adaptation
item.description: We propose to reconcile this conflict by aligning the entropy minimization objective with that of the pseudo labels' cross entropy.

item.title: Intervening With Confidence: Conformal Prescriptive Monitoring of Business Processes
item.description: Prescriptive process monitoring methods seek to improve the performance of a process by selectively triggering interventions at runtime (e. g., offering a discount to a customer) to increase the probability of a desired case outcome (e. g., a customer making a purchase).

item.title: Truthful Meta-Explanations for Local Interpretability of Machine Learning Models
item.description: As a result, the demand for a selection tool, a meta-explanation technique based on a high-quality evaluation metric, is apparent.

item.title: MEDIAR: Harmony of Data-Centric and Model-Centric for Multi-Modality Microscopy
item.description: Cell segmentation is a fundamental task for computational biology analysis.

item.title: ZegCLIP: Towards Adapting CLIP for Zero-shot Semantic Segmentation
item.description: Recently, CLIP has been applied to pixel-level zero-shot learning tasks via a two-stage scheme.

item.title: Teaching Matters: Investigating the Role of Supervision in Vision Transformers
item.description: We compare ViTs trained through different methods of supervision, and show that they learn a diverse range of behaviors in terms of their attention, representations, and downstream performance.

item.title: Discovering Latent Knowledge in Language Models Without Supervision
item.description: Existing techniques for training language models can be misaligned with the truth: if we train models with imitation learning, they may reproduce errors that humans make; if we train them to generate text that humans rate highly, they may output errors that human evaluators can't detect.

item.title: Fairness and Explainability: Bridging the Gap Towards Fair Model Explanations
item.description: Although research efforts have been devoted to measuring and mitigating bias, they mainly study bias from the result-oriented perspective while neglecting the bias encoded in the decision-making procedure.

item.title: GLeaD: Improving GANs with A Generator-Leading Task
item.description: Generative adversarial network (GAN) is formulated as a two-player game between a generator (G) and a discriminator (D), where D is asked to differentiate whether an image comes from real data or is produced by G. Under such a formulation, D plays as the rule maker and hence tends to dominate the competition.

item.title: Specifying Behavior Preference with Tiered Reward Functions
item.description: Next, we propose an environment-independent tiered reward structure and show it is guaranteed to induce policies that are Pareto-optimal according to our preference relation.

item.title: WIDER & CLOSER: Mixture of Short-channel Distillers for Zero-shot Cross-lingual Named Entity Recognition
item.description: In this study, a mixture of short-channel distillers (MSD) method is proposed to fully interact the rich hierarchical information in the teacher model and to transfer knowledge to the student model sufficiently and efficiently.

item.title: SimVTP: Simple Video Text Pre-training with Masked Autoencoders
item.description: This paper presents SimVTP: a Simple Video-Text Pretraining framework via masked autoencoders.

item.title: A Generative Approach for Script Event Prediction via Contrastive Fine-tuning
item.description: First, the pretrained language models adopted by current works ignore event-level knowledge, resulting in an inability to capture the correlations between events well.

item.title: Stochastic Rising Bandits
item.description: This paper is in the field of stochastic Multi-Armed Bandits (MABs), i. e., those sequential selection techniques able to learn online using only the feedback given by the chosen option (a. k. a.

item.title: Slimmable Pruned Neural Networks
item.description: Slimmable Neural Networks (S-Net) is a novel network which enabled to select one of the predefined proportions of channels (sub-network) dynamically depending on the current computational resource availability.

item.title: Learning Continuous Depth Representation via Geometric Spatial Aggregator
item.description: Depth map super-resolution (DSR) has been a fundamental task for 3D computer vision.

item.title: Diffusion-SDF: Text-to-Shape via Voxelized Diffusion
item.description: Previous approaches lack flexibility in both 3D data representation and shape generation, thereby failing to generate highly diversified 3D shapes conforming to the given text descriptions.

item.title: FacT: Factor-Tuning for Lightweight Adaptation on Vision Transformer
item.description: Recent work has explored the potential to adapt a pre-trained vision transformer (ViT) by updating only a few parameters so as to improve storage efficiency, called parameter-efficient transfer learning (PETL).

item.title: Semantic-aware Message Broadcasting for Efficient Unsupervised Domain Adaptation
item.description: In this way, our message broadcasting encourages the group tokens to learn more informative and diverse information for effective domain alignment.

item.title: ABN: Anti-Blur Neural Networks for Multi-Stage Deformable Image Registration
item.description: Recent research on deformable image registration is mainly focused on improving the registration accuracy using multi-stage alignment methods, where the source image is repeatedly deformed in stages by a same neural network until it is well-aligned with the target image.

item.title: Adaptive Testing of Computer Vision Models
item.description: Vision models often fail systematically on groups of data that share common semantic characteristics (e. g., rare objects or unusual scenes), but identifying these failure modes is a challenge.

item.title: Iterative Next Boundary Detection for Instance Segmentation of Tree Rings in Microscopy Images of Shrub Cross Sections
item.description: We analyze the problem of detecting tree rings in microscopy images of shrub cross sections.

item.title: Document-Level Abstractive Summarization
item.description: The task of automatic text summarization produces a concise and fluent text summary while preserving key information and overall meaning.

item.title: Supervised Tractogram Filtering using Geometric Deep Learning
item.description: A tractogram is a virtual representation of the brain white matter.

item.title: ZeroKBC: A Comprehensive Benchmark for Zero-Shot Knowledge Base Completion
item.description: However, there has been limited research on the zero-shot KBC settings, where we need to deal with unseen entities and relations that emerge in a constantly growing knowledge base.

item.title: ERNet: Unsupervised Collective Extraction and Registration in Neuroimaging Data
item.description: Our code and data can be found at https://github. com/ERNetERNet/ERNet

item.title: InternVideo: General Video Foundation Models via Generative and Discriminative Learning
item.description: Specifically, InternVideo efficiently explores masked video modeling and video-language contrastive learning as the pretraining objectives, and selectively coordinates video representations of these two complementary frameworks in a learnable manner to boost various video applications.

item.title: Dist-PU: Positive-Unlabeled Learning from a Label Distribution Perspective
item.description: Positive-Unlabeled (PU) learning tries to learn binary classifiers from a few labeled positive examples with many unlabeled ones.

item.title: Towards human-compatible autonomous car: A study of non-verbal Turing test in automated driving with affective transition modelling
item.description: Participants rode in autonomous cars (driven by either human or AI drivers) as a passenger and judged whether the driver was human or AI.

item.title: Loss Adapted Plasticity in Deep Neural Networks to Learn from Data with Unreliable Sources
item.description: When data is streaming from multiple sources, conventional training methods update model weights often assuming the same level of reliability for each source; that is: a model does not consider data quality of each source during training.

item.title: Benchmarking AutoML algorithms on a collection of binary problems
item.description: Automated machine learning (AutoML) algorithms have grown in popularity due to their high performance and flexibility to adapt to different problems and data sets.

item.title: Switching to Discriminative Image Captioning by Relieving a Bottleneck of Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Discriminativeness is a desirable feature of image captions: captions should describe the characteristic details of input images.

item.title: UniGeo: Unifying Geometry Logical Reasoning via Reformulating Mathematical Expression
item.description: Naturally, we also present a unified multi-task Geometric Transformer framework, Geoformer, to tackle calculation and proving problems simultaneously in the form of sequence generation, which finally shows the reasoning ability can be improved on both two tasks by unifying formulation.

item.title: FretNet: Continuous-Valued Pitch Contour Streaming for Polyphonic Guitar Tablature Transcription
item.description: In this paper, we present a GTT formulation that estimates continuous-valued pitch contours, grouping them according to their string and fret of origin.

item.title: Tackling Data Heterogeneity in Federated Learning with Class Prototypes
item.description: We propose FedNH, a novel method that improves the local models' performance for both personalization and generalization by combining the uniformity and semantics of class prototypes.

item.title: Proposal of a Score Based Approach to Sampling Using Monte Carlo Estimation of Score and Oracle Access to Target Density
item.description: Score based approaches to sampling have shown much success as a generative algorithm to produce new samples from a target density given a pool of initial samples.

item.title: Robust convex biclustering with a tuning-free method
item.description: Therefore, we propose a tuning-free method for automatically selecting the optimal robustification parameter with high efficiency.

item.title: Simple Baseline for Weather Forecasting Using Spatiotemporal Context Aggregation Network
item.description: Traditional weather forecasting relies on domain expertise and computationally intensive numerical simulation systems.

item.title: SSDA3D: Semi-supervised Domain Adaptation for 3D Object Detection from Point Cloud
item.description: However, these UDA solutions just yield unsatisfactory 3D detection results when there is a severe domain shift, e. g., from Waymo (64-beam) to nuScenes (32-beam).

item.title: Semantic-Conditional Diffusion Networks for Image Captioning
item.description: The rich semantics are further regarded as semantic prior to trigger the learning of Diffusion Transformer, which produces the output sentence in a diffusion process.

item.title: Union-set Multi-source Model Adaptation for Semantic Segmentation
item.description: Model adaptation is proposed as a new domain adaptation problem which requires access to a pre-trained model instead of data for the source domain.

item.title: Knowledge-Bridged Causal Interaction Network for Causal Emotion Entailment
item.description: Moreover, social-interaction CSK serves as emotion-level bridge (E-bridge) and action-level bridge (A-bridge) to connect candidate utterances with the target one, which provides explicit causal clues for the Emotional Interaction module and Actional Interaction module to reason the target emotion.

item.title: Robust Point Cloud Segmentation with Noisy Annotations
item.description: To handle boundary-level label noise, we also propose a variant ``PNAL-boundary " with a progressive boundary label cleaning strategy.

item.title: PØDA: Prompt-driven Zero-shot Domain Adaptation
item.description: Domain adaptation has been vastly investigated in computer vision but still requires access to target images at train time, which might be intractable in some conditions, especially for long-tail samples.

item.title: IncepFormer: Efficient Inception Transformer with Pyramid Pooling for Semantic Segmentation
item.description: Semantic segmentation usually benefits from global contexts, fine localisation information, multi-scale features, etc.

item.title: DiffusionInst: Diffusion Model for Instance Segmentation
item.description: This paper proposes DiffusionInst, a novel framework that represents instances as instance-aware filters and formulates instance segmentation as a noise-to-filter denoising process.

item.title: Towards a more efficient computation of individual attribute and policy contribution for post-hoc explanation of cooperative multi-agent systems using Myerson values
item.description: A quantitative assessment of the global importance of an agent in a team is as valuable as gold for strategists, decision-makers, and sports coaches.

item.title: Super-resolution Probabilistic Rain Prediction from Satellite Data Using 3D U-Nets and EarthFormers
item.description: To further improve the model performance, multi-model ensemble and threshold optimization were used to produce the final probabilistic rain prediction.

item.title: Neural Machine Translation with Contrastive Translation Memories
item.description: Retrieval-augmented Neural Machine Translation models have been successful in many translation scenarios.
